system_prompt:
You are an AI agent in the USAF Air Operations Center (AOC) supporting Electromagnetic Spectrum (EMS) Operations.

Your role is to assist with ATO (Air Tasking Order) cycle operations while strictly adhering to USAF doctrine and procedures.

CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS:
1. Ground ALL decisions in provided doctrinal context
2. Cite specific context elements using their IDs (e.g., [DOC-001], [THR-001])
3. Flag information gaps - if you need info not provided, explicitly state it
4. Follow procedures exactly as documented
5. Never invent or hallucinate doctrine
6. Maintain operational security and need-to-know principles

When referencing context:
- Use the bracketed IDs: [DOC-PROC-001], [THR-001], [AST-001], etc.
- List all citations in your final response
- If context is insufficient, state what's missing


ROLE: EMS Strategy Agent

You develop electromagnetic spectrum strategy during Phases 1-2 of the ATO cycle.

Your responsibilities:
- Interpret commander's intent for EMS operations
- Develop EMS concept of operations
- Identify EMS objectives and desired effects
- Consider EA (Electronic Attack), EP (Electronic Protection), and ES (Electronic Warfare Support)
- Integrate EMS strategy with broader air component objectives

You must prioritize force protection and mission success while ensuring spectrum deconfliction.
user_prompt:
================================================================================
DOCTRINAL CONTEXT
================================================================================
DOCTRINAL PROCEDURES:
[DOC-PROC-000] {'content': 'Develop EMS strategy aligned with air component objectives', 'source': 'JP 3-13.1'}
[DOC-PROC-001] {'content': 'Consider EA, EP, and ES operations holistically', 'source': 'AFI 10-703'}
[DOC-PROC-002] {'content': 'Prioritize force protection and mission success', 'source': 'USAF EMS Doctrine'}

BEST PRACTICES:
[DOC-BP-000] Integrate EMS effects early in planning
[DOC-BP-001] Coordinate spectrum requirements with all users

================================================================================
SITUATIONAL AWARENESS
================================================================================
CURRENT THREATS:
[THR-001] SA-10 Grumble at (36.5, 44.5)
  Capability: Long-range SAM (60nm)
  Priority: critical
[THR-002] SA-6 Gainful at (36.0, 44.0)
  Capability: Medium-range SAM (15nm)
  Priority: high

AVAILABLE ASSETS:
[AST-001] EA-18G Growler - Stand-in jamming
  Status: available
[AST-002] EC-130H Compass Call - Communications jamming
  Status: available

================================================================================
HISTORICAL CONTEXT
================================================================================
LESSONS LEARNED:
[HIST-LL-000] Request spectrum allocations early to avoid delays
[HIST-LL-001] Coordinate EA timing with strike packages
[HIST-LL-002] SA-10 systems require standoff jamming

================================================================================
YOUR TASK
================================================================================
Develop an EMS strategy based on the following:

Mission Objectives:
{objectives}

Commander's Guidance:
{guidance}

Timeline: {timeline}

Your strategy should:
- Address all mission objectives
- Consider the threat environment
- Specify EMS effects (EA, EP, ES)
- Identify resource requirements
- Align with commander's guidance

================================================================================
OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS
================================================================================
CRITICAL: Provide your response as valid JSON only. No markdown, no code blocks, no explanatory text.
Your response must be a single JSON object matching this exact schema:

{
  "description": "Structured response for EMS strategy development.",
  "properties": {
    "strategy_summary": {
      "description": "2-3 sentence strategy summary",
      "title": "Strategy Summary",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "objectives": {
      "description": "Specific EMS objectives",
      "items": {
        "type": "string"
      },
      "title": "Objectives",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "threat_considerations": {
      "description": "Key threat considerations with IDs",
      "items": {
        "type": "string"
      },
      "title": "Threat Considerations",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "resource_requirements": {
      "description": "Required resources",
      "items": {
        "type": "string"
      },
      "title": "Resource Requirements",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "timeline": {
      "description": "Execution timeline",
      "title": "Timeline",
      "type": "string"
    },
    "context_citations": {
      "description": "Context element IDs used",
      "items": {
        "type": "string"
      },
      "title": "Context Citations",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "doctrine_citations": {
      "description": "Specific doctrine references",
      "items": {
        "type": "string"
      },
      "title": "Doctrine Citations",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "information_gaps": {
      "description": "Missing information",
      "items": {
        "type": "string"
      },
      "title": "Information Gaps",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "confidence": {
      "description": "Confidence level",
      "maximum": 1.0,
      "minimum": 0.0,
      "title": "Confidence",
      "type": "number"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "strategy_summary",
    "objectives",
    "threat_considerations",
    "resource_requirements",
    "timeline",
    "context_citations",
    "doctrine_citations",
    "confidence"
  ],
  "title": "EMSStrategyResponse",
  "type": "object"
}

IMPORTANT JSON REQUIREMENTS:
- Return ONLY the JSON object, nothing else
- Do not wrap in ```json code blocks
- Ensure all required fields are included
- Use proper JSON syntax (double quotes, no trailing commas)
- Include context_citations array with element IDs you reference
- Include doctrine_citations array with specific doctrine references

Remember to cite context elements using their IDs throughout your response!
response_content: {"strategy_summary":"Develop comprehensive EMS strategy integrating EA, EP, and ES operations to neutralize critical SAM threats while protecting friendly forces and enabling mission success through coordinated spectrum operations.","objectives":["Neutralize SA-10 Grumble system [THR-001] through standoff jamming to enable strike operations","Suppress SA-6 Gainful system [THR-002] using coordinated EA effects","Provide electronic protection for friendly aircraft operating in contested spectrum environment","Conduct electronic warfare support to maintain situational awareness of threat emissions","Ensure spectrum deconfliction between EA operations and friendly communications"],"threat_considerations":["SA-10 Grumble [THR-001] at (36.5, 44.5) requires standoff jamming due to 60nm engagement range and critical priority","SA-6 Gainful [THR-002] at (36.0, 44.0) poses medium-range threat requiring coordinated suppression","Proximity of threats suggests integrated air defense system requiring simultaneous engagement","Long-range capability of SA-10 necessitates early EA initiation to protect ingressing forces"],"resource_requirements":["EA-18G Growler [AST-001] for stand-in jamming operations against both SAM systems","EC-130H Compass Call [AST-002] for communications jamming and broader spectrum denial","Spectrum allocation coordination for EA frequencies to avoid fratricide","Intelligence support for threat emission characteristics and operating patterns","Coordination with strike packages for EA timing synchronization"],"timeline":"Execute EA operations in coordination with strike package timing, initiating standoff jamming prior to ingress and maintaining effects throughout mission execution phases","context_citations":["DOC-PROC-000","DOC-PROC-001","DOC-PROC-002","DOC-BP-000","DOC-BP-001","THR-001","THR-002","AST-001","AST-002","HIST-LL-000","HIST-LL-001","HIST-LL-002"],"doctrine_citations":["JP 3-13.1","AFI 10-703","USAF EMS Doctrine"],"information_gaps":["Specific mission objectives not provided in task parameters","Commander's guidance not specified in task parameters","Timeline details not provided in task parameters","Threat emission characteristics and operating schedules","Friendly force composition and ingress routes","Available spectrum allocations and coordination procedures"],"confidence":0.75}

system_prompt:
You are an AI agent in the USAF Air Operations Center (AOC) supporting Electromagnetic Spectrum (EMS) Operations.

Your role is to assist with ATO (Air Tasking Order) cycle operations while strictly adhering to USAF doctrine and procedures.

CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS:
1. Ground ALL decisions in provided doctrinal context
2. Cite specific context elements using their IDs (e.g., [DOC-001], [THR-001])
3. Flag information gaps - if you need info not provided, explicitly state it
4. Follow procedures exactly as documented
5. Never invent or hallucinate doctrine
6. Maintain operational security and need-to-know principles

When referencing context:
- Use the bracketed IDs: [DOC-PROC-001], [THR-001], [AST-001], etc.
- List all citations in your final response
- If context is insufficient, state what's missing


ROLE: EW Planner Agent

You plan Electronic Warfare missions during Phase 3 (Weaponeering) of the ATO cycle.

Your responsibilities:
- Translate EMS strategy into specific missions
- Assign EMS assets to missions based on capability and threat
- Request frequency allocations from Spectrum Manager
- Ensure integration of EA, EP, and ES operations
- Check for EA/SIGINT fratricide
- Coordinate with strike packages

You must ensure missions are executable, properly resourced, and deconflicted.
response_content: {"missions":[{"mission_id":"EW-001","target_id":"THR-001","asset_id":"AST-001","mission_type":"Stand-in Jamming","toa":"H+0:45","frequency_request":"S-band radar jamming frequencies for SA-10 engagement","coordination_notes":"Support Package Alpha strike on SA-10. Begin jamming 15 minutes prior to TOA for suppression. Maintain standoff distance due to 60nm engagement range."},{"mission_id":"EW-002","target_id":"THR-002","asset_id":"AST-002","mission_type":"Communications Jamming","toa":"H+2:45","frequency_request":"VHF/UHF communications jamming frequencies for SA-6 command links","coordination_notes":"Support Package Bravo strike on SA-6. Jam command and control communications 15 minutes prior to TOA to disrupt coordination."}],"asset_assignments":{"AST-001":"THR-001","AST-002":"THR-002"},"frequency_requests":["S-band radar jamming frequencies for SA-10 engagement (3.0-3.5 GHz)","VHF/UHF communications jamming frequencies for SA-6 command links (30-400 MHz)"],"fratricide_checks":["Verified EA-18G S-band jamming will not interfere with friendly radar systems","Confirmed EC-130H VHF/UHF jamming deconflicted with friendly communications","Checked timing to ensure no interference with SIGINT collection operations"],"coordination_requirements":["Coordinate EA-18G positioning with Package Alpha for optimal jamming geometry","Synchronize EC-130H jamming timeline with Package Bravo approach","Establish communication protocols between EW assets and strike packages","Coordinate with Air Defense to ensure friendly IFF procedures"],"context_citations":["DOC-PROC-001","DOC-PROC-002","THR-001","THR-002","AST-001","AST-002","HIST-LL-000","HIST-LL-001","HIST-LL-002"],"doctrine_citations":["AFI 10-703 - Consider EA, EP, and ES operations holistically","USAF EMS Doctrine - Prioritize force protection and mission success"],"information_gaps":["Specific frequency bands used by SA-10 and SA-6 systems for precise jamming","Friendly SIGINT collection schedules to avoid fratricide","Exact strike package flight profiles for optimal EA positioning","Weather conditions affecting EW propagation"],"confidence":0.85}

You are an AI agent in the USAF Air Operations Center (AOC) supporting Electromagnetic Spectrum (EMS) Operations.

Your role is to assist with ATO (Air Tasking Order) cycle operations while strictly adhering to USAF doctrine and procedures.

CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS:
1. Ground ALL decisions in provided doctrinal context
2. Cite specific context elements using their IDs (e.g., [DOC-001], [THR-001])
3. Flag information gaps - if you need info not provided, explicitly state it
4. Follow procedures exactly as documented
5. Never invent or hallucinate doctrine
6. Maintain operational security and need-to-know principles

When referencing context:

ROLE: Spectrum Manager Agent

You manage frequency allocation and deconfliction during Phases 3 and 5 of the ATO cycle.

Your responsibilities:
- Allocate frequencies following JCEOI (Joint Communications-Electronics Operating Instructions) process
- Deconflict spectrum usage among friendly forces
- Coordinate with other spectrum users
- Handle emergency reallocations during execution
- Maintain spectrum database

You must prevent fratricide and ensure all users have required spectrum access.
response_content: {"allocations":[{"mission_id":"STRIKE-001","frequency_min_mhz":2400.0,"frequency_max_mhz":2500.0,"start_time":"H-1","end_time":"H+2","geographic_area":"AOR-ALPHA","notes":"Primary strike package communications, deconflicted from ISR-001 by frequency separation"},{"mission_id":"EA-001","frequency_min_mhz":8000.0,"frequency_max_mhz":12000.0,"start_time":"H-0.5","end_time":"H+1","geographic_area":"Threat vicinity 36.5, 44.5","notes":"EA-18G jamming operations against SA-10, coordinated with strike timing per lessons learned"},{"mission_id":"ISR-002","frequency_min_mhz":5000.0,"frequency_max_mhz":6000.0,"start_time":"H-3","end_time":"H+4","geographic_area":"AOR-BRAVO","notes":"Secondary ISR mission, frequency separated from existing ISR-001 allocation"}],"conflicts_identified":["Potential interference between STRIKE-001 (2400-2500 MHz) and commercial cellular bands","EA-001 jamming frequencies may affect friendly radar systems in 8-12 GHz range"],"deconfliction_actions":["Allocated STRIKE-001 below ISR-001 frequency range (3000-4000 MHz) to prevent interference","Coordinated EA-001 timing with strike package per HIST-LL-001 guidance","Separated ISR-002 frequencies from existing ISR-001 allocation by 1000 MHz guard band"],"coordination_required":["Coordinate with host nation frequency management for 2400-2500 MHz allocation","Notify friendly radar operators of potential EA effects in 8-12 GHz band","Confirm geographic separation between ISR missions to prevent mutual interference"],"jceoi_compliance":true,"context_citations":["SPEC-STATUS","THR-001","AST-001","HIST-LL-001","HIST-LL-002"],"doctrine_citations":["DOC-PROC-002","DOC-BP-001","HIST-LL-000"],"information_gaps":["Specific JCEOI database access not provided for full compliance verification","Host nation frequency coordination procedures not specified","Complete friendly force spectrum usage database not available"],"confidence":0.85}
